concept.title: DITA 1.3 support
concept.shortdesc: DITA Open Toolkit provides preliminary processing support for the upcoming OASIS DITA 1.3 specification. Initial preview support for this specification was added in version 2.0 of the toolkit; version 2.2 extends this foundation to support key scopes and branch filtering along with additional DITA 1.3 features.

conbody.p: Because DITA 1.3 is fully backwards compatible with previous DITA DTDs and schemas, DITA-OT 2.2 will provide the proposed 1.3 materials as the default DTDs for processing. The XML Catalog resolution maps any references for DITA 1.2 doctypes to the 1.3 DTDs, for example. All processing ordinarily dependent on the 1.0, 1.1, or 1.2 definitions continues to work as usual, and any documents that make use of the newer DITA 1.3 elements or attributes will be supported with specific new processing. Documents created with the proposed OASIS DITA 1.3 DTDs are the only ones ever likely to have features that invoke the specific new 1.3-based processing support.

Because this support is based on a yet-to-be-approved version of the proposed OASIS , if you choose to investigate any 1.3-based function, be aware that the 1.3 implementation in this version of the toolkit is preliminary. Upon final approval of the DITA 1.3 standard, toolkit developers will review the implementation to make certain that it conforms to the final specification.

section.title: Initial Preview Support for DITA 1.3 in DITA-OT 2.0
section.p: The following DITA 1.3 features were implemented in version 2.0 of the toolkit. Issue numbers correspond to the tracking number in the GitHub issues tracker.

ul.li: #1652 Add DITA 1.3 markup and xml domain support (milestone 4)

section.title: Additional DITA 1.3 support in DITA-OT 2.2
section.p: The following DITA 1.3 features were implemented in version 2.2 of the toolkit.

li.p: #1648 Initial support for DITA 1.3 key scopes
#1637 Initial implementation of DITA 1.3 branch filtering

The implementation is a separate module that is run before keyref processing. The process will
Initially split braches so that each branch will only contain a single ditavalref
Generate @copy-to attributes for each branch-generated <topicref>
Filter the map based on branch filters
Rewrite duplicate generated copy-to targets with a numbered -# suffix
Copy and filter generated copy-to targets
Filter topics that were not branch-generated

section.note: For the latest status information on DITA 1.3-related features in version , see the DITA 1.3 label in the GitHub issues tracker.
